intro: Hypochaeris sessiliflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sowthistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–60 cm, with basal leaves that are sessile and often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, oval-shaped seeds. Hypochaeris sessiliflora is often found in disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
